chunks: The AI Photo Enhancer automatically adjusts exposure, contrast, and color balance using deep learning models.
It includes a noise‑reduction algorithm that preserves fine details.
Real‑time preview allows users to see the enhancement before saving.
Batch processing can handle up to 500 images in a single operation.
The enhancer works best with RAW files but also supports JPEGs.

messages.content: {"summary": "The AI Photo Enhancer in X100 uses deep‑learning to auto‑adjust exposure, contrast, color balance, and reduce noise while preserving detail. Users get a real‑time preview, can batch‑process up to 500 images, and it works best with RAW files but also supports JPEGs."}

source_summaries: The AI Photo Enhancer in X100 uses deep‑learning to auto‑adjust exposure, contrast, color balance, and reduce noise while preserving detail. Users get a real‑time preview, can batch‑process up to 500 images, and it works best with RAW files but also supports JPEGs.

messages.content:
{"faq_markdown": "### FAQ – AI Photo Enhancer (X100)

**Q1: How do I install the AI Photo Enhancer?**
A: The enhancer is included in the X100 firmware. Update your camera to the latest version via Settings → Firmware Update. No additional installation is required.

**Q2: How do I enable the AI Photo Enhancer when shooting?**
A: Press the *AI* button on the camera’s rear panel or select *AI Photo Enhancer* in the shooting menu. The feature runs automatically after each shot.

**Q3: What does the real‑time preview show?**
A: After you capture an image, a side‑by‑side view appears showing the original on the left and the AI‑enhanced version on the right. You can toggle the preview on/off in Settings → Preview Options.

**Q4: Can I process multiple photos at once?**
A: Yes. In the *Batch Process* mode you can select up to 500 images from the SD card. The AI enhancer will apply the same settings to all images.

**Q5: Which file formats are supported?**
A: RAW (NEF, CR2) and JPEG files are fully supported. RAW files receive the highest quality enhancements.

**Q6: How does the noise‑reduction work?**
A: The enhancer uses a deep‑learning model trained on millions of photos to reduce sensor noise while preserving fine details and texture.

**Q7: My photos look blurry after using the enhancer. What can I do?**
A: Ensure the camera’s focus is locked before shooting. If blur persists, try disabling *Sharpness Boost* in Settings → AI Enhancer Options, or use a tripod for low‑light scenes.

**Q8: Any tips for low‑light photography?**
A: Use the *Low‑Light Mode* which adjusts exposure and applies additional noise reduction. Keep the ISO as low as possible and consider using a external light source."}
Updating the public help site with the newly generated FAQ.

arguments.faq_content:
### FAQ – AI Photo Enhancer (X100)

**Q1: How do I install the AI Photo Enhancer?**
A: The enhancer is included in the X100 firmware. Update your camera to the latest version via Settings → Firmware Update. No additional installation is required.

**Q2: How do I enable the AI Photo Enhancer when shooting?**
A: Press the *AI* button on the camera’s rear panel or select *AI Photo Enhancer* in the shooting menu. The feature runs automatically after each shot.

**Q3: What does the real‑time preview show?**
A: After you capture an image, a side‑by‑side view appears showing the original on the left and the AI‑enhanced version on the right. You can toggle the preview on/off in Settings → Preview Options.

**Q4: Can I process multiple photos at once?**
A: Yes. In the *Batch Process* mode you can select up to 500 images from the SD card. The AI enhancer will apply the same settings to all images.

**Q5: Which file formats are supported?**
A: RAW (NEF, CR2) and JPEG files are fully supported. RAW files receive the highest quality enhancements.

**Q6: How does the noise‑reduction work?**
A: The enhancer uses a deep‑learning model trained on millions of photos to reduce sensor noise while preserving fine details and texture.

**Q7: My photos look blurry after using the enhancer. What can I do?**
A: Ensure the camera’s focus is locked before shooting. If blur persists, try disabling *Sharpness Boost* in Settings → AI Enhancer Options, or use a tripod for low‑light scenes.

**Q8: Any tips for low‑light photography?**
A: Use the *Low‑Light Mode* which adjusts exposure and applies additional noise reduction. Keep the ISO as low as possible and consider using a external light source.
